arts.ttl: Aston Villa up to seventh as Watkins haunts Brentford
arts.sum: Brentford pushed for an equaliser, with Keane Lewis-Potter striking a post, but they could not stop Villa from completing a first Premier League double over them as they recovered from their 4-1 loss at Crystal Palace last time out. The striker came back to haunt his former club in the Premier League, beating Mark Flekken at his near post to score the winner early in the second half.
Brentford head coach Thomas Frank says a mid-table finish for Brentford would be "amazing" after losing 1-0 to Aston Villa in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Unai Emery singles out Aston Villa star for praise after surprise start in Brentford win
arts.sum: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery has given his verdict on the 1-0 win over Brentford in the Premier League Unai Emery singles out Aston Villa star for praise after surprise start in Brentford win

arts.ttl: Unai Emery wants Aston Villa to be ‘extremely demanding’ for rest of the season
arts.sum: Ollie Watkins’ 49th-minute strike secured a 1-0 win against Brentford.

arts.ttl: Unai Emery and Thomas Frank disagree as Brentford penalty claim falls on deaf ears
arts.sum: Unai Emery and Thomas Frank disagree as Brentford penalty claim falls on deaf ears However, Frank was backed up by Bees forward Keane Lewis-Potter, who came closest to a goal for the hosts when he struck a Villa post in the second half.

arts.ttl: Emery proud of Villa's victory versus the Bees
arts.sum: Fixtures Brentford Vs. Aston Villa - Sat, Mar 8th 2025, 17:30 Unai Emery was a proud man after Aston Villa left Brentford with all three points in the Premier League on Saturday. The visitors edged a goalless first half, enjoying more possession and shots, before taking the lead shortly after the interval via Ollie Watkins. A quickfire second was ruled out by VAR before Villa showed all their battling qualities to keep the hosts at bay in the time that remained. “I’m very proud of the players,” Emery said. “We planned this match as a key [game] because we’re not going to play in the Premier League for the next 25 days. “We’re going to play in the Champions League and then it’s the break. We’re coming back with the FA Cup and then Brighton is our next match in the Premier League to try to feel comfortable, confident and believing in our way. “It was very important to compete today like we did in Bruges and try to get those three points, knowing the difficulties we were facing. “We did a fantastic job in the first half. We dominated, created chances and played wishing to win. We didn’t concede a lot to them and in the second half we scored one goal and then a second goal, but VAR refused it. “After it, they were progressively dominating more and pushing us to defend in a low block, and we needed the goalkeeper. Robin Olsen was fantastic today and the back four did a great job. “We had some transitions as well, like with Ollie Watkins, to score the second goal, but how we competed today, how we imposed our game plan and how we won the duels was like how we planned before.” Robin Olsen came in for his first Premier League start of the season in goal and kept the team’s fourth clean sheet of the campaign. The defensive display was a crucial factor in earning a third straight victory in all competitions. Emery said: “It was very important to win through a clean sheet and feel confidence with the goalkeeper and the block defensively. “The supporters of Aston Villa were helping us and I’m thankful for their support and how they are enjoying the way. “They are competing with us as well to get good emotions and to feel together.”

arts.ttl: A mid-table finish for Brentford is amazing- Frank positive despite Villa defeat
arts.sum: Brentford head coach Thomas Frank says a mid-table finish for Brentford would be "amazing" after losing 1-0 to Aston Villa in the Premier League.
Aston Villa head coach Unai Emery praises his side's "fantastic" defence as they beat Brentford 1-0 to boost their hopes of a top-four finish in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Aston Villa fans send clear message about Axel Disasi after win over Brentford
arts.sum: Aston Villa have given their European qualification hopes a boost thanks to their 1-0 win away at Brentford on Saturday. Ollie Watkins once again haunted...

arts.ttl: John Townley's Aston Villa player ratings after 1-0 win at Brentford
arts.sum: He thought he scored Villa's second goal just after Watkins' opener, but VAR ruled it out. Villa then broke the deadlock at the start of the second period as Watkins fired past Mark Flekken inside the box.
